intro: Piaranthus streyianus, commonly known as the Strey's pincushion, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its dense, spiky foliage and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Piaranthus streyianus is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
